content:
Looks like many/most/all of my hyperlinks are broken after transition.
The names of the files in pagecontent used to change, and now they remain the same, correct?

Here is my current output:
image.png

The filenames used to lose the 1_, 2_ prefix in the translation, correct?

Ah, shoot, yes. Now with the elimination of a separate ig-data folder (and all the necessary file copying, etc.) we can't rename your files safely -- so we don't. This is something we should have covered in the Migration Guide, but I think we totally missed it. I'm sorry. The best way forward for you is either to change your links, or to rename your files w/out the prefixes and use the pages property in sushi-config.yaml to specify the order of the pages.
@Chris Moesel can you update the migration doc ASAP?
The pages property is covered in the SUSHI Configuration documentation.
@Mark Kramer -- sure, I'll get right on it.

Other than that nit, the transition was very smooth.
This monkey managed to follow the clear instructions without any problems.

Nice work!
Thanks for your feedback, @Saul Kravitz. We've added a step for this to the Migration document: https://fshschool.org/docs/sushi/migration/#3---adjust-page-names-or-links
